intro: Tradescantia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, purple, or white, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Tradescantia mexicana is also valued for its ability to tolerate drought and its ornamental appeal.
